avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. Avalanches are hardly to be expected.

snowpackStructure.comment: A few centimetres of new fallen snow lie on an often load-bearing melt-freeze crust or, on sunny slopes, up to high altitudes on the ground that has already been covered with snow. On shady slopes, the old melt-freeze crust is sometimes not load-bearing. At higher and higher altitudes, faceted crystals can often be found below the melt-freeze crust right down to the ground.

tendency.highlights: Low avalanche danger over the turn of the year.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Avoid small, fresh snowdrift accumulations in the steep terrain adjacent to the ridgeline
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is low. In the steep terrain adjacent to the ridgeline in northern, eastern and southern aspects, small, fresh snowdrift accumulations can be triggered locally as a small snow slab by slight additional load. The risk of being swept away and falling must be taken into account.

snowpackStructure.comment: There is little new fallen snow on a melt-freeze crust, which is often stable, or up to high altitudes on sunny slopes on ground that has already been covered with snow. On shady slopes, the old melt-freeze crust is sometimes not stable. In some places, small, fresh snowdrift accumulations lie prone to triggering on surface hoar. At higher and higher altitudes, faceted crystals can often be found below the melt-freeze crust.

tendency.highlights: Low avalanche danger over the turn of the year.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Little new and wind slab snow - danger of falling on hard old snow surface
